current-chamber.#text: In the House of Representatives, U. S.,

official-title.#text: Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 96) establishing the budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2015 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2016 through 2024, and providing for proceedings during the period from April 11, 2014, through April 25, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may, pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XVIII, declare the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: resolved into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for consideration of the concurrent resolution (

) establishing the budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2015 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2016 through 2024. The first reading of the concurrent resolution shall be dispensed with. All points of order against consideration of the concurrent resolution are waived. General debate shall not exceed four hours, with three hours of general debate confined to the congressional budget equally divided and controlled by the
and one hour of general debate on the subject of economic goals and policies equally divided and controlled by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: chair and ranking minority member of the Committee on the Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or their respective designees. After general debate the concurrent resolution shall be considered for amendment under the five-minute rule. The concurrent resolution shall be considered as read. No amendment shall be in order except those printed in the report of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Representative Carolyn Maloney of New York

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: accompanying this resolution. Each amendment may be offered only in the order printed in the report, may be offered only by a Member designated in the report, shall be considered as read, and shall be debatable for the time specified in the report equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an opponent. All points of order against such amendments are waived except that the adoption of an amendment in the nature of a substitute shall constitute the conclusion of consideration of the concurrent resolution for amendment. After the conclusion of consideration of the concurrent resolution for amendment and a final period of general debate, which shall not exceed 10 minutes equally divided and controlled by the
, the Committee shall rise and report the concurrent resolution to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: chair and ranking minority member of the Committee on the Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with such amendment as may have been adopted. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the concurrent resolution and amendments thereto to adoption without intervening motion except amendments offered by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: chair of the Committee on the Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to achieve mathematical consistency. The concurrent resolution shall not be subject to a demand for division of the question of its adoption.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 305(a)(5) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974

text.#text: That at any time after the adoption of this resolution the
On any legislative day during the period from April 11, 2014, through April 25, 2014—
the Journal of the proceedings of the previous day shall be considered as approved; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: adjourned to meet at a date and time, within the limits of clause 4, section 5, article I of the Constitution, to be announced by the Chair in declaring the adjournment.

text.#text: the Chair may at any time declare the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may appoint Members to perform the duties of the Chair for the duration of the period addressed by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as though under clause 8(a) of rule I.
shall not constitute a calendar day for purposes of

text.#text: Each day during the period addressed by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 7 of the War Powers Resolution

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may, at any time before 5 p.m. on Thursday, April 17, 2014, file privileged reports to accompany measures making appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2015.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 544 EH: Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 96) establishing the budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2015 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2016 through 2024, and providing for proceedings during the period from April 11, 2014, through April 25, 2014.
